original: Atterbom, Hjalmar Lennart Ama-deus, fd. major, Göteborg, f. 8/9/80 i Gbg av majoren VVK Ernst A. o. Augusta Tigerschiöld. G. 1. 06 m. Ruth Jonsson, d.; 2. 45 m. Esther Katharina Beyer f. Lundholm. Barn: Per-Axel f. 13. — Stud :ex. i Gbg 99, off :ex. 01, SS 06, 23 o. 29, signalkuris 08, KHS 09-11. Res. t. de fl. europ. länder 07-47, Nordafrika, Västindien, USA o. Bermudas 36, USA, Västindien o. de flesta länder i Sydamerika 38, USA o. Västindien 39. Und:löjtn. v. Västgöta reg. 01, major v. Södra skåns’ka inf :reg. 26. Reg:adjut. 03-05, reg :kvart :mäst. 12-16, förste taktiklär. v. KHS res :off :-kurser 16, 17 o. 18, adjut. v. KS 19-22, chef f. studikomp. 25 o. 26, brig:-kvart :mäst. 26, mob:off. 26-35, ordf. i inskrivn :nd 27, 29, 30, 31, 33, 35 o. 40. Led. av slyr. f. Västgöta Dal-Bohus travkl. 12-25, ordf. i IFK Vänersborg 24-25, ordf. i Idr :-trusten i Vänersborg 25, ordf. i Södra skånska inf :reg. ’skyttefören. 28-34, led. av styr, f. Travellei# club i Gbg 45-46, av KAK o. KDAK. Hobbies: bdksamling o. resor. RSO, RDDO, Chr. X:s FrM, Akad. Skyttecorps’ GM.
translated: Atterbom, Hjalmar Lennart Ama-deus, former major, from Gothenburg, born on September 8, 1880 in Gothenburg to Major VVK Ernst A. and Augusta Tigerschiöld. Married twice: 1st marriage in 1906 to Ruth Jonsson (deceased); 2nd marriage in 1945 to Esther Katharina Beyer, née Lundholm. Children: Per-Axel born in 1913. He graduated from secondary school in Gothenburg in 1899, officer school in 1901, Signal School in 1908, and from the Army Staff College in 1923 and 1929. He traveled to several European countries from 1907 to 1947, North Africa, the West Indies, the United States, and Bermuda in 1936, the United States, the West Indies, and most countries in South America in 1938, the United States and the West Indies in 1939. He was a second lieutenant in the Västgöta regiment in 1901 and a major in the Southern Skåne Infantry Regiment in 1926. He was the regimental adjutant from 1903-1905, regimental quartermaster from 1912-1916, first tactics teacher at the Army Staff College from 1916 to 1918, adjutant at the War College from 1919-1922, head of the study company in 1925 and 1926, brigade quartermaster in 1926, mobilization officer from 1926 to 1935, and chairman of the conscription board in 1927, 1929, 1930, 1931, 1933, 1935, and 1940. He was a member of the leadership of the Westgöta-Dal-Bohus horse racing club from 1912 to 1925, chairman of the IFK Vänersborg in 1924-1925, chairman of the Sports Trust in Vänersborg in 1925, chairman of the Southern Skåne Infantry Regiment shooting association from 1928 to 1934, member of the board of Travellei# Club in Gothenburg from 1945 to 1946, of the Royal Automobile Club, and of the Royal Aero Club. His hobbies include book collections and travel. He was awarded the RSO, RDDO, Christian X's Freedom Medal, and the Academy Shooting Corps’ Grand Master.

structured.honorificSuffix: RSO, RDDO, Chr. X's FrM, Akad. Skyttecorps’ GM
